name: Visa Inc. v. Osborn
question: Are allegations that members of a business organization agreed to adhere to the organization’s rules and also possessed governance rights to the organization sufficient to plead that there was a conspiracy under the Sherman Act?
description: A case in which the Court would have determined whether allegations that members of a business organization agreed to adhere to the organization’s rules and possessed governance rights to the organization are sufficient to plead that there was a conspiracy under the Sherman Act.
